definition: to board at school
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
school/military officer/CL:所[suo3]
to proofread/to check/to compare

sentences.english: Wang Jing in Changping, a secondary school, usually resident.
sentences.chinese: 王静在昌平一所中专读书，平常住校。

sentences.english: High school students are boarders, at least in our school is.
sentences.chinese: 高中生都是住校的，最起码我们学校是。

sentences.english: Before I lodge in school dormitory, I never think of this question.
sentences.chinese: 在我住校前，我从来没有想过这个问题。

sentences.english: Each resident student is issued an IC card with his/her personal information stored on it.
sentences.chinese: 每个住校生都会发一张IC卡，上面存储着个人信息。

sentences.english: Boys who live at school sleep in a dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 住校的男生在宿舍里睡觉。

sentences.english: Currently, there are 87 girls who live at the school.
sentences.chinese: 目前学校里住校学习的有87的孩子。

sentences.english: I think the majority of boarders should be very much agree with the move of the.
sentences.chinese: 我想大多数住校生应当非常赞同这一举措的了。

sentences.english: Some home from school, the students ' dormitory is the choice is near home.
sentences.chinese: 有些家离学校远的学生选择住校，近的则回家。

sentences.english: All full - time student in residence each person of every year hotel expense 1100 Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 所有全日制住校生每人每年住宿费1100元。

sentences.english: I am live at school live, therefore lives in the dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 我是住校生，所以住在宿舍里。

sentences.english: I often go on residential summer courses .
sentences.chinese: 我经常去学习必须住校的暑期课程。

sentences.english: Virtually all of Stanfords undergraduates live on campus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有斯坦福的本科生都住校。

sentences.english: I am a live-in students, so live in the dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 我是住校生，所以住在宿舍里。

sentences.english: He hopes to  live in although his home is not far from the college.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他家离学校不远，他仍希望住校。
